alert.note: Alert for Comanche; Eastland; Erath; Jack; Palo Pinto; Stephens; Wise; Young (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 08 at 7:49AM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Young, northwestern Erath, northwestern Wise, Eastland, Jack, eastern Stephens, Palo Pinto and northwestern Comanche Counties through 845 AM CST... At 748 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bryson to 6 miles south of Cisco. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Eastland, Bryson, Necessity, Possum Kingdom State Park, Caddo, and Possum Kingdom Lake around 755 AM CST. Ranger and Lake Olden around 800 AM CST. Jacksboro, Lake Leon, and Palo Pinto Mountains State Park around 805 AM CST. Fort Richardson State Park around 810 AM CST. Graford around 820 AM CST. Palo Pinto around 825 AM CST. Lake Bridgeport around 830 AM CST. Gordon and Lake Palo Pinto around 835 AM CST. Other locations impacted by these storms include Nimrod, Kokomo, Lost Creek Reservoir, Cundiff, Staff, Okra, Crafton, Joplin, Morton Valley, and Bartons Chapel. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 327 and 376. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Comanche; Eastland; Erath; Jack; Palo Pinto; Stephens; Wise; Young
